Text: FW London LPG Book Cc Lousie I would be grateful if you could review the transaction below which will require your approval As outlined below the client Borealis wishes to change the terms of the contract given our current situation RAC is comfortable with the changes as it will result in a significant saving in storage costs and allow the LPG trader to flatten his book Further whilst there maybe the potential of MTM movement between the purchase price from Borealis and the subsequent sale index related price back to the counterpart this will be netted out RAC has significant risk appetite for this counterpart which is a sound credit rated E The only issue is whether Houston has sufficient resources or are willing to pay the storage costs early which could range between If this is feasible I will recommend that we negotiate a discount of on storage costs saving as opposed to Kind rgds Nish Original Message From Petersen Bo Sent November To Patel Nish Subject London LPG Book Enron put MT of Propane in storage under a term agreement contract QA in a facility in Sweden managed and owned by a company called Borealis Enron under the contract agreed to pay per MT for the right to utilize the storage Due to Swedish law Enron cancould not have title to the product in Sweden and Borealis paid Enron under a preagreed price formula per MT Upon Enrons sale of the product and subsequent lifting a payment of the storage fee would become due to Borealis The likely timeframe for selling the product would be Jan as that is the highest OTC swap price mkt which in turn would mean payment to Borealis would be due on days past BL ie early Feb Borealis are very concerned about Enrons ability to meet its payment obligation and has suggested a transaction that in several ways would suit the LPG book Pls let me know if you need further information Bo Petersen An upfront payment this week of the storage payment with a reduction of dollars for the storage fee savings Borealis would purchase the Product in tank at an indexed related price which would fit the London LPG book very well The contractual obligations to lift the storage tons would be further complicated by the fact that the one physical trader most likely will not be here much longer Pls let me know if you need further information Bo Petersen
